metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 45 axioms covering execution control, plan beginning, progress tracking, completion, abstraction levels, aspectual operations, and distraction including left fringe analysis, preconditions, temporal execution control, and plan interruption/resumption
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified execution processes, temporal control operations, and aspectual predicates

axioms.title: Definition of leftFringe
axioms.fol: (forall (s p) (iff (leftFringe s p) (exists (a g s1) (and (plan p a g)(subgoalsOf s1 p) (forall (e t) (iff (and (member e s)(begins t e)) (and (subgoalIn e p)(begins t e) (not (exists (e1 t1) (and (subgoalIn e1 p) (begins t1 e1) (imply s1 b) (before' b t1 t))))))))))))
axioms.english: The "left fringe" of a plan is the set of all those subgoals that can be done first, that is, those subgoals such that there is no subgoal that must be achieved before it. s is the left fringe of plan p when p is a plan by some agent a to achieve goal g with subgoals s1, and s is the set of subgoals of p for which there does not exist another subgoal e1 in p which must occur before e.

axioms.title: Simultaneous subgoals in left fringe theorem
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 t p s) (if (and (begins t e1)(begins t e2) (subgoalIn e1 p)(subgoalIn e2 p)(leftFringe s p)) (iff (member e1 s)(member e2 s))))
axioms.english: It is a theorem that if two subgoals of a plan must begin to be executed simultaneously, then either both or neither will be in the left fringe of the plan.

axioms.title: Top-level goal in left fringe theorem
axioms.fol: (forall (p a g s) (if (and (plan p a g)(leftFringe s p)) (member g s)))
axioms.english: The top-level goal in a plan is a limiting case of a subgoal. Executing any of the subgoals of a goal entails that we are in the process of executing the goal. Thus, there cannot be any of its subgoals that must be executed before the goal. It is a theorem that the top-level goal is in the left fringe of the plan.

axioms.title: Definition of precondition
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (iff (precondition e p) (exists (s e1) (and (leftFringe s p)(member e1 s)(enable e e1)))))
axioms.english: A precondition of a plan is a precondition of a subgoal in the left fringe of the plan. Preconditions are not part of the plan. Otherwise e would be in the left fringe of the plan rather than e1.

axioms.title: Definition of satisfiedPrecondition
axioms.fol: (forall (e p t) (iff (satisfiedPrecondition e p t) (and (precondition e p)(atTime e t))))
axioms.english: Preconditions of plans may be satisfied at the time the plan is executed.

axioms.title: Definition of unsatisfiedPrecondition
axioms.fol: (forall (e p t) (iff (unsatisfiedPrecondition e p t) (and (precondition e p)(not (atTime e t)))))
axioms.english: Preconditions of plans may be unsatisfied at the time the plan is executed.

axioms.title: Definition of violatePrecondition
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 e p t) (iff (violatePrecondition' e0 e p t) (exists (e1 e2) (and (changeFrom' e2 e1)(gen e2 e0) (satisfiedPrecondition' e1 e p t) (atTime e0 t)))))
axioms.english: Satisfied preconditions can become unsatisfied during the execution of a plan.

axioms.title: Definition of executionEnvironment
axioms.fol: (forall (s p) (iff (executionEnvironment s p) (exists (a g) (and (plan p a g) (forall (e) (iff (member e s) (exists (e1 e2) (and (subgoalIn e1 p)(not' e2 e1) (or (causallyInvolved e e1) (causallyInvolved e e2))))))))))
axioms.english: There is a subset of state characteristics that have a relationship to an execution. These are the states and events that are causally involved in the occurrence or nonoccurrence of the subgoals in the plan. We can call this the execution environment. p is a plan by agent a to achieve goal g, and s is the set of eventualities e which are causally involved in some subgoal e1 in p happening or not happening.

axioms.title: Definition of enabledPlan
axioms.fol: (forall (p a g t) (iff (enabledPlan p a g t) (and (plan p a g) (forall (e) (if (precondition e p)(atTime e t))))))
axioms.english: A plan is enabled if all its preconditions hold.

axioms.title: Definition of beginExecute
axioms.fol: (forall (a p) (iff (beginExecute a p) (exists (g e s) (and (plan p a g)(member e s)(leftFringe s p) (execute a e p)))))
axioms.english: To begin the execution of a plan is to execute an action in the left fringe of the plan.

axioms.title: Definition of executing
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 p t) (iff (executing a e1 p t) (exists (e) (and (execute' e a e1 p)(atTime e t)))))
axioms.english: An agent is executing an action of a plan at time t if the execution takes place at that time.

axioms.title: Definition of executingPlan
axioms.fol: (forall (a p t) (iff (executingPlan a p t) (exists (e1) (executing a e1 p t))))
axioms.english: At any moment t an agent a can be executing one or more plans p. For a to execute plan p at time t is for a to be executing a subgoal of p at that time.

axioms.title: Definition of executed
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 p t) (iff (executed a e1 p t) (exists (e t0) (and (execute' e a e1 p)(ends t0 e) (before t0 t)))))
axioms.english: We would like to be able to keep track of those parts of a plan that have already been completed. We can define a predicate executed saying that the execution of the action has already taken place by a particular time.

axioms.title: Goal execution completeness condition
axioms.fol: (forall (a e p t) (iff (executed a e p t) (forall (e1) (and (if (and (subgoal e1 e)(agentOf a e1)) (executed a e1 p t)) (if (and (subgoal e1 e)(not (agentOf a e1))) (happensInTime e1 p))))))
axioms.english: The purpose of the subgoals of a goal is to bring about the goal. Thus, a goal has been executed when all its subgoals have been executed and vice versa. Agent a has executed subgoal e of plan p by time t. a has executed all the actions a was agent of. All other events happened at the appropriate time.

axioms.title: Definition of executedPlan
axioms.fol: (forall (a p t) (iff (executedPlan a p t) (exists (g) (and (plan p a g)(executed a g p t)))))
axioms.english: Because of this rule, we can define an entire plan to have been executed when its top-level goal has been executed.

axioms.title: Definition of remainingPlan
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 a p t) (iff (remainingPlan p1 a p t) (exists (g s0 s s1) (and (plan p a g)(subgoalsOf s0 p) (relationsOf s p)(relationsOf s1 p1) (forall (e0) (iff (subgoalIn e0 p1) (or (and (subgoalIn e0 p)(agentOf a e0) (not (executed a e0 p t))) (and (subgoalIn e0 p) (not (agentOf a e0)) (exists (t1 e3) (and (begins' e3 e0 t1) (imply s0 e3) (before t t1))))))) (forall (r e1 e2) (iff (subgoal' r e1 e2) (iff (member r s1) (and (member r s)(subgoalIn e1 p1) (subgoalIn e2 p1)))))))))
axioms.english: Now we can define the "remaining plan" p1 of plan p at time t as that part of p that has not yet been executed. p1 is that part of agent a's plan p that remains to be done at time t. p is a plan by a to achieve goal g; it also labels as s0 the set of subgoals of p. Among the subgoals in p1 are the subgoals in p that have not yet been executed by a. Among the subgoals of p1 are the subgoals of p that a is not the agent of and that must begin at some time t1 after t. The subgoal relations of p1 are those of p that are between subgoals that remain in p1.

axioms.title: Definition of executionStartTime
axioms.fol: (forall (t1 e a p) (iff (executionStartTime t1 e a p) (and (executePlan' e a p)(begins t1 e))))
axioms.english: There is a time that an agent begins the execution of a plan. t1 is the start time of execution e by agent a of plan p.

axioms.title: Definition of executionEndTime
axioms.fol: (forall (t2 e a p) (iff (executionEndTime t2 e a p) (and (executePlan' e a p)(ends t2 e))))
axioms.english: There is a time that an agent ends the execution of a plan. The definition is similar to that for executionStartTime.

axioms.title: Definition of executionDuration
axioms.fol: (forall (d a p t0 u) (iff (executionDuration d a p t0 u) (exists (e t1 t) (and (executePlan' e a p)(executionStartTime t1 e a p) (intervalBetween t t1 t0)(durationOf d t u)))))
axioms.english: There is a total duration for the amount of time that a plan has been being executed as of time t0. d is the duration in units u of agent a's execution of plan p as of time t0.

axioms.title: Definition of missDeadline
axioms.fol: (forall (a p) (iff (missDeadline a p) (exists (t2) (and (deadline t2 p) (not (exists (e t1) (and (executePlan' e a p) (executionEndTime t1 e a p) (before t1 t2))))))))
axioms.english: The concept of a deadline was defined in Chapter 42 on Scheduling. Agents can fail to execute a plan or subplan by its deadline. Agent a misses the deadline for plan p if and only if there is a deadline t2 for p and there is no execution e of the plan whose end time was before t2.

axioms.title: Definition of executionCost
axioms.fol: (forall (c e a p) (iff (executionCost c e a p) (and (executePlan' e a p)(cost c e a))))
axioms.english: The cost of an execution to an agent is easily expressed in terms of that predicate.

axioms.title: Definition of executionSuccess
axioms.fol: (forall (e a p) (iff (executionSuccess e a p) (exists (g) (and (executePlan' e a p)(plan p a g)(cause e g)))))
axioms.english: The execution of a plan can result in the achievement of the goal.

axioms.title: Definition of executionFailure
axioms.fol: (forall (e a p) (iff (executionFailure e a p) (exists (g) (and (executePlan' e a p)(plan p a g) (not (cause e g))(not (Rexist g))))))
axioms.english: The execution of a plan can fail to result in the achievement of the goal. For the execution of a plan to fail, not only must the execution not cause the top-level goal to come about, the top-level goal also cannot come about for reasons unrelated to the plan.

axioms.title: Definition of instantiatePlan
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p) (iff (instantiatePlan p1 p) (exists (a g g1 s s1 r r1) (and (plan p a g)(plan p1 a g1)(imply g1 g) (subgoalsOf s p)(subgoalsOf s1 p1) (relationsOf r p)(relationsOf r1 p1) (subset s s1)(subset r r1)))))
axioms.english: Plans can be at various levels of specificity. In a more abstract plan the identity of some of the participants and props may be unspecified and the times of some of the actions may not be fixed. Once we add properties to the plan, by elaborating the subgoals of the plan, then we are creating a new plan that is an instantiation of the old plan. The goal g1 of the more specific plan p1 is something that entails the goal g of the more general plan p, and subgoals and subgoal relations in p are also in p1. Plan p1 fills in details of plan p, including possibly temporal constraints.

axioms.title: Definition of sameAbstractPlan
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p2 p) (iff (sameAbstractPlan p1 p2 p) (exists (a g) (and (plan p1 a g)(plan p2 a g) (instantiatePlan p1 p)(instantiatePlan p2 p) (forall (e) (if (subgoalIn e p)(nontemporal e)))))))
axioms.english: Two plans are the same abstract plan if all their nontemporal goals are the same. This means that they are both instantiations of the same nontemporal abstract plan. This concept will allow us to talk about plans that are the same except that one is displaced in time with respect to the other. Plans p1 and p2 are instantiations of the same abstract plan p. p1 and p2 have the same agent and the same goal. There is an abstract plan p that they both instantiate. Abstract plan p has no temporal constraints.

axioms.title: People execute actions in plans
axioms.fol: (forall (a) (if (person a) (exists (p e g) (and (plan p a g)(execute a e p)))))
axioms.english: People execute actions in plans.

axioms.title: People defeasibly execute scheduled plans
axioms.fol: (forall (a p g s e) (if (and (person a)(plan p a g)(scheduledPlan p)(leftFringe s p) (member e s)(etc)) (execute a e p)))
axioms.english: People defeasibly execute the plans that they had scheduled to do. This axiom only states that they defeasibly execute the left fringe of their scheduled plans, but once they do, they will defeasibly execute the left fringe of the remainder, so that defeasibly they will execute the entire scheduled plan.

axioms.title: Definition of reusablePlan
axioms.fol: (forall (p a g) (iff (reusablePlan p a g) (exists (p1 p2 t1 t2) (and (instantiatePlan p1 p)(instantiatePlan p2 p) (timeSpanOf t1 p1)(timeSpanOf t2 p2)(nequal t1 t2)))))
axioms.english: A reusable plan is a plan that is sufficiently abstract that it can be instantiated at two different times.

axioms.title: Definition of activity
axioms.fol: (forall (p s) (iff (activity p s) (exists (g) (forall (a) (if (member a s)(reusablePlan p a g))))))
axioms.english: An activity is an abstract plan that can be instantiated multiple times (i.e., is reusable) and is a plan that all members of a group s have.

axioms.title: Definition of start - left fringe execution
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p) (iff (start' e0 a p) (exists (e1 e s e2) (and (changeTo' e2 e1)(gen e2 e0)(execute' e1 a e p)(member e s) (leftFringe s p)))))
axioms.english: To start a plan is to start to execute an action in its left fringe.

axioms.title: Definition of start - plan execution state
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p) (iff (start' e0 a p) (exists (e1 e2) (and (changeTo' e2 e1)(gen e2 e0)(executePlan' e1 a p)))))
axioms.english: Equivalently, to start a plan is to change to a state of executing the plan.

axioms.title: Definition of continue - remaining plan execution
axioms.fol: (forall (a p t) (iff (continue a p t) (exists (p1 s e) (and (remainingPlan p1 a p t)(leftFringe s p1) (member e s)(executing a e p t)))))
axioms.english: To continue to execute a plan at time t is to execute an action in the left fringe of the remaining plan at time t.

axioms.title: Definition of continue - plan execution state
axioms.fol: (forall (a p t) (iff (continue a p t)(executingPlan a p t)))
axioms.english: Equivalently, to continue to execute a plan at time t is to be executing the plan at time t.

axioms.title: Definition of stop
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p) (iff (stop' e0 a p) (exists (e e1) (and (changeFrom' e1 e)(gen e1 e0)(executePlan' e a p)))))
axioms.english: To stop the execution of a plan is to change from executing it to not executing it.

axioms.title: Definition of postpone
axioms.fol: (forall (eo a p t1 t2) (iff (postpone' e0 a p t1 t2) (exists (e1 p1 e2 p2 e3 e4) (and (executePlan' e1 a p1) (executionStartTime t1 e1 a p1) (executePlan' e2 a p2) (executionStartTime t2 e2 a p2) (sameAbstractPlan p1 p2 p) (change' e3 e1 e2)(before t1 t2) (cause' e4 a e3)(gen e4 e0)))))
axioms.english: To postpone the execution of a plan is to change the time at which the plan will start to be executed to a later time. e0 is the eventuality in which agent a postpones executing abstract plan p from time t1 to time t2. The executions and start times of the two instantiations of plan p are labeled. These are both instantiations of p. e3 is the change from one instantiation to the other, later one. a's causing this change generates the postponing action.

axioms.title: Definition of complete
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p t) (iff (complete' e0 a p t) (exists (e1 e2 e3) (and (executedPlan' e1 a p t)(changeTo' e2 e1) (cause' e3 a e2)(gen e3 e0)))))
axioms.english: To complete a plan is to cause a change into the state of having executed it.

axioms.title: Definition of interrupt
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p t) (iff (interrupt' e0 a p t) (exists (e1) (and (stop' e1 a p)(gen e1 e0)(atTime e0 t) (not (complete a p t))))))
axioms.english: To interrupt a plan is to cause the plan to stop without completing it.

axioms.title: Definition of resume
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p1 t2) (iff (resume' e0 a p1 t2) (exists (p2 t1 p3 p e1) (and (interrupt a p1 t1)(remainingPlan p2 a p1 t1) (sameAbstractPlan p3 p2 p)(before t1 t2) (start' e1 a p3)(gen e1 e0)(atTime e0 t2)))))
axioms.english: To resume a plan is to start the remaining part of the plan after it has been interrupted. e0 is the eventuality of agent a resuming original plan p1 at time t2. This holds if there was an interruption of p1 at time t1, before t2, where the remaining plan at that time was p2. There is a new instance p3 of the same abstract plan p as p2 that starts at time t2, and this starting generates the resumption.

axioms.title: Definition of restart
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p1 t2) (iff (restart' e0 a p1 t2) (exists (t1 p3 p e1) (and (interrupt a p1 t1) (sameAbstractPlan p3 p1 p)(before t1 t2) (start' e1 a p3)(gen e1 e0)(atTime e0 t2)))))
axioms.english: To restart a plan is to start it from the beginning after having interrupted it. This definition differs from the definition of resume only in that the new plan p3 is an instantiation of the original plan p1 rather than of the remaining plan at the time of the interruption.

axioms.title: Definition of pause
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p t1) (iff (pause' e0 a p t1) (exists (t2 e1) (and (stop' e1 a p)(gen e1 e0)(atTime e0 t1) (resume a p t2)(before t1 t2)))))
axioms.english: To pause in a plan is to stop and to resume. The stopping generates the pausing action, but the resuming has to occur at some subsequent point. It's possible to intend to pause but have it later turn out that it was merely a stopping because there was no resumption.

axioms.title: Definition of pauseInterval
axioms.fol: (forall (t e1) (iff (pauseInterval t e1) (exists (a p t1 e2 t2) (and (pause' e1 a p t1)(atTime e1 t1) (resume' e2 a p t2)(before t1 t2) (forall (e3 t3) (if (and (resume' e3 a p t3)(before t1 t3)) (or (equal e3 e2)(before t2 t3)))) (intervalBetween t t1 t2)))))
axioms.english: The pause interval is the interval between the stop and the resumption. Interval t is the interval between the time t1 that a pause begins and the time t2 the execution of a plan resumes. The pause event e1 and the resume event e2 are labeled and the former precedes the latter. e2 is the first such resume event.

axioms.title: Definition of ongoing
axioms.fol: (forall (a p t) (iff (ongoing a p t) (forall (t1) (if (insideTime t1 t) (or (executingPlan a p t1) (pause a p t1))))))
axioms.english: The execution of a plan is ongoing for a time interval t if it is either being executed or there is a pause in its execution. That is, ongoing spans pauses. Agent a's execution of plan p is ongoing during time interval t exactly when at all instants t1 inside t, there is an execution of p happening at t1 or there is a pause happening at t1.

axioms.title: Definition of suspend
axioms.fol: (forall (e a p t) (iff (suspend' e a p t) (exists (e1 t2 e2) (and (interrupt' e2 a p t)(gen e2 e)(intend a e1) (resume' e1 a p t2)))))
axioms.english: To suspend the execution of a plan is to interrupt the execution of the plan with the intention of resuming it. The distinction between pausing and suspending is that with suspending there is only the intention to resume. The plan may not actually be resumed. Something is not a pause unless the resumption actually happens.

axioms.title: Definition of abort
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p t) (iff (abort' e0 a p t) (exists (e5) (and (interrupt' e5 a p t)(gen e5 e0) (forall (t2) (if (before t t2) (exists (e1 e2 e3 e4) (and (intend a e1)(not' e1 e2) (restart' e2 a p t2) (intend a e3)(not' e3 e4) (resume' e4 a p t2)))))))))
axioms.english: To abort the execution of a plan is to interrupt the execution of the plan with the intention not to restart or resume it. e0 is an aborting by agent a of the execution of plan p at time t. This holds if e0 is generated by an interruption by a of p at t and for all subsequent times, a intends not to restart or resume the execution of p.

axioms.title: Definition of terminate
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a p t) (iff (terminate' e0 a p t) (exists (e1) (and (or (complete' e1 a p t)(abort' e1 a p t)) (gen e1 e0)))))
axioms.english: A plan is terminated when it is completed or aborted.

axioms.title: Definition of distract
axioms.fol: (forall (e a x y) (iff (distract' e a x y) (exists (e1 e2 e0 e3) (and (change' e3 e1 e2)(gen e3 e)(thinkOf' e1 a x) (thinkOf' e2 a y) (arg* y e0)(causallyInvolved e0 e3)))))
axioms.english: Distraction happens when there is a change for an agent from thinking of one thing x to thinking of another thing y, where some property of y (e.g., its proximity to the agent) plays a causal role in the change.

axioms.title: Execution implies thinking defeasible rule
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 p) (if (and (execute a e1 p)(etc)) (and (thinkOf a e1)(thinkOf a p))))
axioms.english: When someone is executing an action in the service of a plan, then defeasibly they are thinking of both the action and the plan.

axioms.title: Distraction causes suspension defeasible rule
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 a p y t) (if (and (executingPlan a p t)(distract' e1 a p y) (atTime e1 t)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (suspend' e2 a p t)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: It is a defeasible inference that if something distracts us while we are executing a plan, it will cause us to suspend that plan. Agent a is executing plan p at time t and is distracted by y at time t. This distraction e1 causes a's suspension e2 of the execution of plan p.

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Extensive use of primed predicates for execution control processes: start', stop', pause', resume', restart', suspend', abort', terminate', complete', interrupt', distract', changeTo', changeFrom', violatePrecondition', execute', executePlan'
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: Two axioms use (etc) condition - people executing scheduled plans and distraction causing suspension
conversion_notes.execution_control_framework: Comprehensive treatment of plan execution control from beginning through completion, interruption, and resumption
conversion_notes.aspectual_operations: Systematic treatment of aspectual predicates (start, continue, stop, pause, resume, etc.) as formal execution control operations
conversion_notes.cross_references: Integration with plan theory, temporal logic, scheduling theory, intention theory, and attention/focus mechanisms
conversion_notes.temporal_coordination: Sophisticated treatment of temporal relationships in execution control including postponement, resumption timing, and pause intervals
conversion_notes.abstract_plan_framework: Formal treatment of plan abstraction levels and instantiation for reusable and collaborative planning
conversion_notes.complex_quantification: Multiple axioms with deeply nested quantification especially in remaining plan, abstract plan, and control operation definitions

file_format_notes.logical_structure: Mix of definitions, implications, and defeasible rules with high complexity concentration
file_format_notes.predicate_consistency: Consistent use of execution control terminology with clear semantic distinctions between control operations
file_format_notes.defeasibility_markers: Two defeasible rules with (etc) conditions for realistic execution behavior
file_format_notes.reification_patterns: Strategic reification of execution control processes and temporal state changes
file_format_notes.execution_framework: Systematic treatment from basic execution through advanced control operations to distraction and interruption
